## Overview
This repository contains the source code for a custom firmware for embedded chips that are able to read, interpret and transmit data of SML-based electric meter devices.

Main features:

‚úÖ read data from customizable input sources

‚úÖ publish data to any MQTT-Broker

‚úÖ task scheduling to manage other code-components (easily extendable)

‚úÖ NTP real-time synchronisation for better scheduling/planning


## Supported SoCs
The focus of this project are Espressif low-power single-core SoCs.
The following SoCs are supported

[![Static Badge](https://img.shields.io/badge/Espressif-ESP8266-E8362D?logo=espressif&logoColor=white&labelColor=%23000)](https://img.shields.io/badge/Espressif-ESP8266-E8362D?logo=espressif&logoColor=white&labelColor=%23000)

## Development 
üìù See issues for current development and upcoming features

## 3rd Party Libraries
- [https://github.com/bertmelis/espMqttClient](https://github.com/bertmelis/espMqttClient)
- [https://github.com/me-no-dev/ESPAsyncTCP](https://github.com/me-no-dev/ESPAsyncTCP)
- [https://github.com/me-no-dev/ESPAsyncWebServer](https://github.com/me-no-dev/ESPAsyncWebServer)
- [https://github.com/plerup/espsoftwareserial](https://github.com/plerup/espsoftwareserial)
- [https://github.com/volkszaehler/libsml](https://github.com/volkszaehler/libsml)
